item.title: Chaos is unpredictable
item.description: What is the nature of chaos? I think it is: an eternal feature of reality it is equivalent to ‚Äúnon existence‚Äù ? .

item.title: Translation
item.description: Because there will always be diversity.

item.title: What is art?
item.description: We‚Äôve figured it out, the age old question. It‚Äôs actually solvable, same vibe as David Bessis‚Äôs claim here: ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve been wrong about math for 2300 years & I‚Äôm here to fix it‚Äù David Bessis claims we can resolve a thousand year philosophical conundrum, and I think that‚Äôs awesome! More of this please defenderofthebasic.substack.com/p/weve-been-wrong-about-math-for-2300 The trick is to recognize that what makes art is relational.

item.title: Tilted Playing Field
item.description: We live in a universe where the playing field is tilted towards GOODNESS, TRUTH, and BEAUTY. Truth is decentralized, lies require coordination Those on the side of evil wish to hide this fact.

item.title: Start at the end
item.description: You learn MUCH faster if you start with the end goal. Like, kids should be shown open questions in the frontier of science when they first start out. Otherwise you can‚Äôt tell what the point is of learning all this stuff (and some of it is genuinely useless).

item.title: Surface vs Solve
item.description: The side mirror blindspot sensor warns you when a car is in your blindspot. It makes the decision FOR you (safe, or not safe to turn). If it fails, you have no way to know this.

item.title: 90-10 prediction
item.description: This is when you make a prediction that: MOST people vote one way, and you are in the minority AND you are right What that demonstrates is that you are on the frontier ...

item.title: üí° The "just ask" principle
item.description: A foundational principle of open memetics is: just ask for people‚Äôs data. People will happily give you their data if they understand why you want it, and feel like it will be good for them.

item.title: ‚≠êÔ∏è Overall impression
item.description: Reviewing the live twitter semantic search in 2025-05-22: Would definitely use it if there was a page I can just type my queries into. Seems equally as useful as Exa‚Äôs internet wide semantic search (Exa used to have twitter as one if its datasources, but was recently removed).
